page.title: 07MALLYDAMS FAIRLIGHT E.SUSSEX
page.content:
Mallydams Field Centre and Nature Reserve is owned by the RSPCA and is in Peter James Lane, Fairlight, East Sussex.
The oldest tree in the Reserve is a cherry and is about 250 years old. Most of the trees are about 50 years old. Silver birch, sweet chestnut, oak and hazel are the most common trees here. The most important tree is the oak as it attracts up to 300 different species of insects. The most common plants are bracken and bluebells. The smallest animal found here is the shrew, and the smallest bird is the goldcrest.
The Reserve has a hospital unit where about 350 injured animals and birds are cared for and released each year.
